title: Mixed Conditionals
description: Learn to combine different conditional tenses to express complex relationships between past causes and present results, or present situations affecting past hypotheticals.

rules.title: Past Condition, Present Result
rules.explanation: Use this mixed conditional when a hypothetical past situation affects the present. The if-clause uses past perfect (third conditional), but the result clause uses would + base verb (second conditional).
rules.structure: If + had + past participle, would + base verb (now)

examples.sentence: If I had exercised regularly when I was young, I would be healthier now.
examples.translation: 젊었을 때 규칙적으로 운동했다면, 지금 더 건강했을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If she hadn't smoked for 20 years, she wouldn't have breathing problems today.
examples.translation: 그녀가 20년간 담배를 피우지 않았다면, 오늘날 호흡 문제가 없었을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If the government had invested in healthcare earlier, the system would be better prepared now.
examples.translation: 정부가 더 일찍 의료에 투자했다면, 시스템이 지금 더 잘 준비되어 있을 것이다.

rules.title: Present Condition, Past Result
rules.explanation: Use this mixed conditional when a permanent or current state would have affected a past situation differently. The if-clause uses past simple (second conditional), but the result clause uses would have + past participle (third conditional).
rules.structure: If + past simple (general truth), would have + past participle

examples.sentence: If I were more patient, I would have handled the stress better last year.
examples.translation: 내가 더 인내심이 있다면, 작년에 스트레스를 더 잘 다뤘을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If he weren't afraid of hospitals, he would have gone for a check-up sooner.
examples.translation: 그가 병원을 두려워하지 않았다면, 더 일찍 검진을 받으러 갔을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If she didn't have allergies, she wouldn't have had that reaction to the medication.
examples.translation: 그녀가 알레르기가 없다면, 그 약에 대한 반응이 없었을 것이다.

rules.title: Mixed Conditional with Modal Verbs
rules.explanation: Mixed conditionals can use modal verbs like 'might', 'could', or 'should' in the result clause to express different degrees of certainty or criticism.
rules.structure: If + had + past participle, might/could/should + base verb OR might/could/should have + past participle

examples.sentence: If you had taken the medicine on time, you might feel better now.
examples.translation: 제시간에 약을 복용했다면, 지금 기분이 나아졌을 수도 있다.

examples.sentence: If she were more health-conscious, she could have avoided this condition.
examples.translation: 그녀가 건강에 더 신경 썼다면, 이 상태를 피할 수 있었을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If they had followed the doctor's advice, they should be fully recovered by now.
examples.translation: 의사의 조언을 따랐다면, 지금쯤 완전히 회복되어 있어야 한다.

rules.title: Mixed Conditional for Regret and Criticism
rules.explanation: Mixed conditionals are often used to express regret about past actions and their present consequences, or to criticize past decisions that affect the current situation.
rules.structure: If + had (not) + past participle, would (not) + base verb

examples.sentence: If I hadn't eaten so much junk food, I wouldn't be on this strict diet now.
examples.translation: 정크푸드를 그렇게 많이 먹지 않았다면, 지금 이 엄격한 다이어트를 하지 않았을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If the hospital had hired more staff, they wouldn't be so overwhelmed today.
examples.translation: 병원이 더 많은 직원을 고용했다면, 오늘날 이렇게 과부하가 걸리지 않았을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If we had addressed mental health earlier, society wouldn't struggle so much with it now.
examples.translation: 정신 건강을 더 일찍 다뤘다면, 사회가 지금 그것으로 이렇게 힘들어하지 않았을 것이다.

rules.title: Inverted Mixed Conditionals
rules.explanation: In formal writing and speech, the if-clause can be inverted (without 'if') for emphasis. 'Had' comes before the subject in past-to-present mixed conditionals.
rules.structure: Had + subject + past participle, would + base verb

examples.sentence: Had I known about the health risks, I would live differently now.
examples.translation: 건강 위험에 대해 알았다면, 지금 다르게 살았을 것이다.

examples.sentence: Had they invested in prevention, they wouldn't be dealing with this epidemic.
examples.translation: 예방에 투자했다면, 이 전염병에 대처하고 있지 않았을 것이다.

examples.sentence: Had the warning signs been taken seriously, the patient would be in better condition.
examples.translation: 경고 신호를 심각하게 받아들였다면, 환자가 더 나은 상태였을 것이다.

rules.title: Mixed Conditionals with Continuous Aspect
rules.explanation: Mixed conditionals can also use continuous forms to emphasize ongoing states or actions.

examples.sentence: If I had been exercising regularly, I would be feeling more energetic now.
examples.translation: 규칙적으로 운동했다면, 지금 더 활력이 넘쳤을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If she hadn't been overworking, she wouldn't be suffering from burnout.
examples.translation: 그녀가 과로하지 않았다면, 번아웃으로 고통받지 않았을 것이다.

examples.sentence: If the clinic had been providing better care, patients would be recovering faster.
examples.translation: 클리닉이 더 나은 치료를 제공했다면, 환자들이 더 빨리 회복하고 있을 것이다.

exercises.question: If I _____ more vegetables when I was younger, I _____ healthier today.
If she _____ (not smoke) for years, she wouldn't have lung problems now.
If he _____ afraid of doctors, he _____ for a check-up last month.
If I _____ (know) about the side effects, I wouldn't be taking this medication.
_____ they invested in healthcare, they wouldn't be facing this crisis now.
If he had exercised regularly, he _____ (not struggle) with his weight now.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using a mixed conditional (past cause, present result)
exercises.original: I didn't take care of my health. Now I have problems.
exercises.answer: If I had taken care of my health, I wouldn't have problems now.

exercises.question: If she were more careful about nutrition, she _____ that allergic reaction yesterday.
If he _____ (be) so stubborn, he would have seen a doctor earlier.
If they had built more hospitals, there _____ enough beds for patients.
